arts.ttl: Bayern Munich’s Vincent Kompany preaches calm response after hectic week
arts.sum: In order to maintain the trust and support of the board and the fan base, Kompany will need to produce at least three wins to close out the month. While Bayern boss Vincent Kompany is a relatively young manager at 38-years-old, his vast playing experience is still serving as a guiding light.

arts.ttl: Max Eberl: Bayern Munich “crushed” Eintracht Frankfurt
arts.sum: “When did Bayern play so dominantly in Frankfurt? “When was the last time Bayern ran six kilometers more in Frankfurt?”

arts.ttl: Thomas Müller keeping a level head after Bayern Munich’s draw to Eintracht Frankfurt
arts.sum: Coming off the back of a midweek defeat to Aston Villa in the Champions League and a draw to Bayer Leverkusen in the Bundesliga, Bayern has gone three consecutive games without a win. Despite a discrepancy between the expected result and the final score, Frankfurt deserved their point, and Bayern has to improve when it comes to defending counter-attacks.

arts.ttl: England dealt yet another Harry Kane injury scare as Vincent Kompany provides update
arts.sum: England captain Harry Kane suffers a second injury scare in as many weeks as he is taken off during Bayern Munich's 3-3 Bundesliga draw with Eintracht Frankfurt.

arts.ttl: Bavarian Podcast Works S7E11: Has Vincent Kompany been exposed? + Why is Harry Kane going missing for Bayern Munich? + Manuel Neuer, time to move on?
arts.sum: After three games without a win, Vincent Kompany’s meteoric rise at the Bavarian capital has come to a standstill. In this episode, INNN and Samrin discuss the following:

arts.ttl: Bayern Munich dominated Eintracht Frankfurt but had nothing to show for it
arts.sum: This was a classic Gladbach performance where Bayern had so many shots yet failed to convert them yet again, not to mention Serge Gnabry, Kingsley Coman, and Manuel Neuer all coming up short when the team needed them the most. Questions will be asked of Kompany, and he needs to act before the situation goes out of hand.

arts.ttl: Vincent Kompany focusing on the positives amid Bayern Munich’s defensive woes in draw to Eintracht Frankfurt
arts.sum: Bayern head coach Vincent Kompany has already established that he likes to focus on the positives, and has once again avoided openly criticizing players. After the match, Kompany was captured (via @iMiaSanMia ) discussing the team’s situation and recent dropped points, explaining, “We played against Leverkusen who won the league with 90 points last season and a very good Frankfurt team that started the season very well.

arts.ttl: Match awards from Bayern Munich’s 3-3 heartbreaking draw to Eintracht Frankfurt
arts.sum: Marmoush has continued building upon a strong season last year, and gave Bayern Munich serious problems on the counter attack. Olise’s goal proved crucial and gave Bayern the advantage.

arts.ttl: Three observations from Bayern Munich’s abysmal 3-3 draw with Eintracht Frankfurt
arts.sum: Not only would a real defensive midfielder have stopped Frankfurt’s quick turnarounds in their very tracks (imagine Palhinha in place of Aleksandar Pavlović in the lead-up to Frankfurt’s first goal), but even simply an added man in the back would give Bayern a numerical advantage (3 to 2) against Frankfurt’s two devasting forwards. Nothing extraordinary and far below expectations as this was a game where wingers could excel and the team could utilize width (especially in the first half) to escape Frankfurt suffocating the Bayern forwards in the box — yet neither provided any meaningful output.

arts.ttl: Barcelona’s front-3 leading Liverpool, Bayern & more as most lethal in 2024/25
arts.sum: A head-turning statistic, highlighting the excellence of Barcelona’s frontline across the season to date, has come to the fore on Sunday evening. As much highlights the remarkable start to the…
